DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Involvement Final Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Final score that represents the percentage of body surface area involved by disease signs and the cutaneous features scale associated with cGVHD (chronic Graft vs. Host Disease).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Skin
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Property.preferredDefinition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Final Skin NIH Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Body surface area involvement is greater than 50 percent and there are any skin features that are Score 3. This score is also used when superficial sclerotic features are present (Score 2), but there is impaired mobility or ulceration (Score 3).

Concepts.definition: Body surface area involvement is greater than 50 percent and there are any skin features that are Score 3. This score is also used when superficial sclerotic features are present (Score 2), but there is impaired mobility or ulceration (Score 3).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Body surface area involvement is 19-50 percent and there are superficial sclerotic features.

Concepts.definition: Body surface area involvement is 19-50 percent and there are superficial sclerotic features.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Body surface area involvement is 1-18 percent.

Concepts.definition: Body surface area involvement is 1-18 percent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Body surface area involvement is 0 percent and there are no sclerotic features.

Concepts.definition: Body surface area involvement is 0 percent and there are no sclerotic features.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
